alert.note: Alert for Shelby; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 1:17AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Talladega and Shelby Counties through 145 AM CST... At 117 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maylene, or near Alabaster, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hoover, Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Calera, Chelsea, Montevallo, Childersburg, Columbiana, Wilsonville, Indian Springs Village, Vincent, Harpersville, Westover, American Village, Oak Mountain State Park, Maylene, Oak Mountain Amphitheater, Shelby County Airport and Joe Tucker Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
